titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The USS Wabash was a steam screw frigate and was laid down in May of 1854 by the Philadelphia Navy Yard and launched in October of 1855. She was commissioned in August 1856, with Captain Frederick K. Engle in command.

scopecontent.p: Manuscript volume, possibly a station bill book for the USS Wabash on seamanship, dated 1856. The volume includes instructions for bending sails, mooring and unmooring, reefing and hoisting, bringing the ship to anchor, manning fire stations, what to do when there is a man overboard, and port routines. The volume also includes blank sheets on which to list the officers and crew of the ship and lists of crew stations.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
